alert.note: Alert for Grand Forks (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 10:43AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Grand Forks and Polk Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Grand Forks, Marshall and Polk Counties. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Cass and Richland Counties. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Maple River near Enderlin affecting Cass and Ransom Counties. Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at East Grand Forks. * WHEN...From late Monday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Extensive flooding along the greenway. (Grand Forks) Point Bridge closes due to water on approach and Eagles Point Trail Head/Park closes. (East Grand Forks) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue rising to 39.2 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
